Create a block comment (multiline comment) in C++:
[!raw!]
{0} this is a  block/multiline
 comment in C++ {1}
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Multi-Line Comments[/h1]

Comments that require multiple lines begin with [b]/*[/b] and end with [b]*/[/b]
You can place them on the same line or insert one or more lines between them. [code format="cpp" codeId="177"]/* This is a comment */

/* C++ comments can
    span multiple lines
 */[/code]

answers.text: Comments are ignored by the compiler
Single line comment starts with an * (asterisk)
Comments are used to confuse programmers

quizzes.question: Which of the following is true?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Using Comments[/h1]

Comments can be written anywhere, and can be repeated any number of times throughout the code.
Within a comment marked with /* and */, // characters have no special meaning, and vice versa. This allows you to "nest" one comment type within the other. [code format="cpp" codeId="178"]/* Comment out printing of Hello world!

  cout << "Hello world!"; // prints Hello world!

*/[/code]
[note]Adding comments to your code is a good practice. It facilitates a clear understanding of the code for you and for others who read it.[/note]
